intro: Manettia divaricata, commonly known as the variegated manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with white or yellow variegation. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Manettia divaricata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
